thread.title: Here are the 10 best public high schools in San Francisco
thread.title_full: Here are the 10 best public high schools in San Francisco

author: Kevin Truong
title: Here are the 10 best public high schools in San Francisco
text: 11 photos San Francisco's list of its best public high schools span neighborhoods across the city from North Beach to the Mission to Diamond Heights to Merced Manor. They also range in specialties from performing and visual arts to science, technology, engineering and mathematics. What the top 10 public high schools in the city do have in common is holding an A plus, A or A minus score from rankings and review company Niche . Additionally, almost across the board, San Francisco public high schools ranked highly when it comes to both racial and economic diversity metrics. 11 photos Check out our slideshow to see the top 10 ranked public high schools in the San Francisco Unified School District >> The company has built up a database of more than 20,000 public high schools around the country scored by a number of different factors including Clubs & Activities, Health & Safety, Resources & Facilities and College Readiness. Coming in at the top is perennial high achiever Lowell High School, which was originally founded back in the 19th century. Ranked by Niche as the best public magnet school in the state, Lowell has an average graduation rate of 98 percent and scored especially high in the metrics of academics, teachers and college readiness. Second place is taken by Ruth Asawa San Francisco School of the Arts. Named in 2014 for the late San Francisco sculptor, the school's departments include Architecture and Design, Creative Writing and Musical Theater. Niche bases its rankings on data from the U.S. Department of Education and millions of K-12 school reviews and survey responses. Click here for the full list of 2017's Best Public High Schools from Niche. Kevin Truong is the multimedia producer for the San Francisco Business Times. Related Content
